page.title: 09Wimbledon Common (2)Windmill
page.content: Commander Dean(the Ranger) lives in a house joined to the Office near the Windmill in the middle of the Common. He works 5 days a week from 8.a.m. sometimes until 10.p.m. if he is the Officer on duty. There are 25 people employed by the Conservators, which includes 3 keepers on horseback and 2 on foot, rates collectors and adminis- trators and men to maintain the trees and ditches. Commander Dean enjoys his job even though dealing with Kingston, Wandsworth and Merton Coucils, clubs and schools using the Common involves a lot of office work. The Windmill and Museum houses an exhibition to show the history of windmilling in England. There have been windmills on Wimbledon Common since before 1600 but the present one was built around 1817. Baden-Powell wrote his book about Boy- Scouting while staying there.(cont -)
